topics.body:
And now for your daily political news:
Yeah; I think it's pretty official that even the republican party knows they're doomed.

If you're wondering what I mean by this to summarize recent news the republican party's 2014 election strategy has shifted drastically from trying to take control of the senate to essentially trying to lame it out and let the clock run out.

The long run election strategy of the GOP has drastically shifted recently cause of recent polling showing them on the presidential level no longer electable.  Now their whole strategy is starting to shift from trying to take control of the government through elections and more towards damage control.  They now face more competition from tea party members and essentially now have to run two elections to get elected with party unity quickly falling apart with republicans and tea party constantly vying for control of the republican party rather than creating party unity.

Tl:dr; GOP 2014 and 2016 election strategy now:
!https://carbonrom.org/wp-content/uploads/2014/02/south-park-bp-sorry1.png!
!http://media.tumblr.com/tumblr_lza8c1Ax8I1r4t3va.gif!
!http://stream1.gifsoup.com/view2/3375668/we-re-sorry-south-park-o.gif!

Side note:
It would probably work too if they weren't being so stupid.
*cough* The lawsuit to try to impeach Obama *cough*
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@Ore-O":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53c2bfac6368723c70a00000#post_53c2bfac6368723c70a00000
!http://bluebrainsblog.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/monty.jpg!

Joking aside to use a analogy what the GOP is essentially doing right now is like a person quitting smoking AFTER they were diagnosed with terminal cancer after years of their doctor warning them that they were going to get cancer.  Quitting smoking this late in the game won't save you.


Reason why the Republican party is doomed post 2016 summarized in one sentence, "They can't get elected without the tea party anymore and they can't get elected with the tea party anymore".
